intro: Eria sundaica, commonly known as the Sunda Orchid, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical rainforests, often as an epiphyte on tree trunks or branches. Its leaves are usually narrow and革质 (leathery), while its flowers come in various colors, including white, yellow, and pink. Due to habitat loss and over-collection, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
